sentences.en: Did your girl friend give a rebuff to you?
sentences.cn: 你的女朋友给你钉子碰 吗 ?

sentences.en: Having made this rash remark, he braced himself for a polite rebuff.
sentences.cn: 他说这冒昧话, 准备碰个软钉子.

sentences.en: He avoided speaking to her, expecting a rebuff.
sentences.cn: 他料想会受到她的冷遇,于是避免和她说话.

sentences.en: He received a humiliating rebuff from his manager.
sentences.cn: 他遭到经理的断然拒绝，十分丢脸。

sentences.en: Her efforts were met with a sharp rebuff.
sentences.cn: 她的努力遭到了断然拒绝.

sentences.en: Her offer of help was met with a sharp rebuff.
sentences.cn: 她主动帮忙，却遭到断然拒绝。
她的拒绝使他的骄气大挫.

sentences.en: His proposals have already been rebuffed by the governor.
sentences.cn: 他的建议已被州长拒绝了。

sentences.en: His reaction was as much of a rebuff as a physical recoil.
sentences.cn: 他的反应既是身体的退缩，也是一种断然的拒绝。

sentences.en: I wondered whether the colonel would take this rebuff.
sentences.cn: 我不知道上校会不会容忍我不服从命令.

sentences.en: If you never fear a rebuff you will never have one.
sentences.cn: 如果你从不怕遭到拒绝,你就绝不会遭到拒绝.

sentences.en: Lily's blood tingled with the grossness of the rebuff.
sentences.cn: 粗鲁的拒绝使丽莉的血液沸腾起来.

sentences.en: Rule persisted with a blink at the rebuff.
sentences.cn: 鲁尔听到这冷冰冰的答复眨了眨眼睛,接着这个话题谈下去.

sentences.en: She almost trembled at the audacity which might have carried her on to a terrible rebuff.
sentences.cn: 想到自己如此狂妄,竟敢到这里来找工作,想到差一点让人粗暴地骂出来,她吓得几乎发抖.

sentences.en: She suffered a rebuff from her manager when she raised the matter.
sentences.cn: 她向经理提出这个问题时碰了一鼻子灰.

sentences.en: The rebuff keyed Roth to defiance.
sentences.cn: 罗思这一声痛斥,连挑战的架势都摆出来了.

sentences.en: The results of the poll dealt a humiliating rebuff to Mr Jones.
sentences.cn: 民意调查的结果对琼斯先生很不利，让他颜面尽失。

words.tran_cn: 断然拒绝；回绝；漠不关心

trans.tran_en: an unkind or unfriendly answer to a friendly suggestion or offer of help
If you rebuff someone or rebuff a suggestion that they make, you refuse to do what they suggest
